summary: Backend adds an `ensureUserRole` method and frontend calls it after login and before saving profiles, which likely resolves the profile-save deadlock via the new bootstrap path. However, the backend still enforces `#user` for `saveCallerUserProfile` and `getCallerUserProfile` without any automatic first-interaction grant, and an always-noop migration file was added despite no demonstrated state upgrade need. Diff summary also indicates multiple unrelated frontend changes (legal text removal, styling/theme/config/docs) not requested in the BuildRequest.

missing_requirements.requirement: Automatically grant the '#user' role to any authenticated caller on first login (or first authenticated interaction) so newly authenticated users can save their profile without pre-existing roles.
missing_requirements.reason: The backend still traps in `saveCallerUserProfile` and `getCallerUserProfile` when the caller lacks `#user`. The diff shows role assignment only occurs when the new `ensureUserRole()` method is called; there is no shown backend-side automatic grant on first authenticated interaction with existing endpoints (e.g., within `saveCallerUserProfile` or `getCallerUserProfile`).

hallucinated_features.description: Added a migration module even though no stable-state upgrade is evidenced/needed (migration `run` returns `old` unchanged).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest says to generate `backend/migration.mo` changes only if existing stable state must be upgraded; the added file appears to be a no-op migration.

hallucinated_features.description: Unrelated frontend content/theme/wording changes (e.g., removing legal/novelty disclaimer text, extensive styling/theme updates, deployment guide additions, new asset-path/config utilities).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest scope is role bootstrap after II login and React Query cache invalidation; the diff summary describes multiple additional frontend changes not requested.
